data.text: @HelenBranswell And so how many with 'epistemic' knowledge have promoted safe/clean indoor air as a monitored public health right for everyone?  It doesn't take as much energy when you know you are right.
@HelenBranswell Willful ignorance is hard to defeat.
@serendipity5460 That we haven't yet learned that the virus is entirely indifferent to our frustration & boredom is stunning to me. It has cost so many lives.
@HelenBranswell I remember those early predictions of 2M. Everyone said it was insane and would never happen. I'm honestly not sure we won't get there.

@HelenBranswell What we did could not possibly be referred to as proper "mitigation" we just react to each wave as it comes and are surprised every time that just because we're bored with it the virus continues to exist.

@HelenBranswell I've long thought we had it in us to reach the 1 million mark.

I'm not happy about that. Just my assessment of my fellow Americans.

@HelenBranswell Schuchat was correct. We did not have proper mitigation. 1 million have died. And another million will undoubtedly die from Covid over the next several years and possibly hundreds of thousands every year from now on
@HelenBranswell Another million to follow in the wake of govâ€™t failure to protect public health . 💔💔💔💔

@HelenBranswell Nearly 1M died with covid, not necessarily from covid. If you don't understand the difference then you don't understand how hospitals were incentivized to code illness during the pandemic.
